SYNC MANAGEMENT
Create a Mobile App Theme

You can create a mobile app theme, and then configure theme components, colors, and buttons. To create a mobile app theme, either clone a theme or manually create one.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience in Enterprise and Unlimited Editions that have Consumer Goods Cloud enabled


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create a mobile app theme:	CGCloud Business Admin
1. From the App Launcher, find and select Sync Management.
Click Mobile App Themes.
Click New.
Enter a name and description for the theme.
To make the theme a default, select Default.
To define a language-specific label, click Add Label, select a language, and enter the label.
To attach a theming .zip file to the mobile theme, click Choose File, select a file, and then click Open.
The theming .zip file contains all the image icons used by the mobile app.
Save your changes.
To create a color or button macro:
Click the Colors or the Buttons tab.
Enter a name and description for the color macro.
Click , choose a color from the color palette.
Save your changes.
To add a component, perform one of these actions.
To create a component, click the Components tab, click New, enter a name, and then save your changes.
To import a component, click the Components tab, click Import, click Upload Files, select a file, and click Import.
To add a mobile app theme component setting:
Click  in the Settings column for a component.
Click New.
Enter a name and description for the setting.
Click , choose a color from the color palette.
Save your changes,
Common Errors While Importing Mobile App Theme Components
When you import a theme component file that doesn’t meet the file import requirements, the import process fails. The table shows the common theme component file import errors and how to fix them.
